agency_desc: A commercial organization that operates a free-to-use website and mobile app that tracks prescription drug prices and offers drug coupons.
service_description: Provides a free prescription discount card; plastic card may be ordered for free. The card is not valid for use with Medicaid or Medicare but may be used instead of health insurance if the price is lower. Cardholders may receive up to 80% discount at participating pharmacies.
site_details: Call or visit the website for information.
site_eligibility: Open

agency_desc: A nonprofit organization that provides a crisis hotline for pregnant women and parents with crisis pregnancy situations such as information and referral, includes connecting parents to resources to prevent newborn abandonment.
service_description: Provides a crisis hotline for mothers, fathers and parents who are experiencing a crisis during pregnancy. Support is offered by information and referral, safe surrender locations, adoption resources, and parenting support. Also provides direction to resources to assist and prevent infant abandonment.
taxonomy_category: Mental Health and Substance Use Disorder Services
site_details: Call for information.
site_eligibility: Pregnant Mother -- Father -- Parents in crisis

agency_desc: A national nonprofit organization that provides a helpline fro parents to call to receive support from trained advocates.
service_description: Provides a telephone counseling and information line that parents and caregivers of children and youth of all ages can call for advice, emotional support, problem-solving, or to get referrals for parenting resources.
site_details: Call for assistance.
site_eligibility: Parents and caregivers of children and youth of all ages

agency_desc: A nonprofit organization that provides in-home school readiness, including science, mentoring relationships, and innovative technologies programs.
service_description: Offers an in-home, early education program sponsored by the State of Indiana (and administered by FSSA). The at-home school readiness program, includes a computer and internet access at no cost. Children develop foundational reading, math, science, and social-emotional skills. Provides positive parent-child interactions while delivering personalized, online instruction 30 minutes a day, 5 days a week, the year before children start school. Also provides parent coaches, fun educational activities.
site_details: Call or visit the website to register.
site_eligibility: Age 4-5 years-old (the year before Kindergarten) -- At or below 127% Federal Poverty Level

agency_desc: A nonprofit organization that provides the following services to participants: daily cost-free calls 365 days a year, safety and wellness checks, access to resources and education, an on-call chaplain for spiritual support, and access to support groups.
service_description: Provides the following services to participants: daily cost-free calls 365 days a year, safety and wellness checks, access to resources and education, an on-call chaplain for spiritual support, and access to support groups.
site_details: Call the office or fill out an online application. Once this has been completed the applicant will receive a call from a staff member to complete the intake process so that they can be paired with a volunteer.
site_eligibility: 50 and older

agency_desc: Not a true "agency," but rather a collection of organizations accepting monetary and/or material donations for individuals impacted by international crises.
service_description: Accepts monetary donations help to restore health, safety, education, economic well-being and power to people devastated by conflict and disaster.

agency_desc: A nonprofit organization that provides housing solutions for service-connected and aging veterans; including repair and rehabilitation.
service_description: Provides home modifications and home repairs for veterans to address health, safety, and accessibility issues, or to address critical home repairs. These include grab rails, wheelchair ramps, accessible bathrooms, and modular additions. This may also include assistance with deferred maintenance, fixed leaks, replaced HVAC systems, or roof replacement.
nameLevel4: Home Maintenance and Minor Repair Services
site_details: Visit website to apply. -OR- Call if a paper application is preferred.

agency_desc: The national government agency that oversees Social Security and Medicare insurance programs.
service_description: Receives, investigates, and attempts to resolve quality-of-care complaints by Medicare beneficiaries, including medication errors, misdiagnoses, delays in treatment, early discharges, incomplete discharge instructions, and inappropriate medical care. This agency can also assist with concerns, at any stage, before or after discharging from a hospital or their skilled services, such as outpatient therapy, skilled nursing care, hospice, or home health care.
site_details: Call for information or to request a formal complaint form to be mailed -OR- Visit website to fill out form electronically.
site_eligibility: Medicare beneficiaries and their caregivers

agency_desc: The national government agency that oversees Social Security and Medicare insurance programs.
site_name: MEDICARE HELPLINE - CENTERS FOR MEDICARE AND MEDICAID SERVICES
service_description: Answers questions, addresses concerns, and provides information to callers regarding all aspects of the Medicare program, including enrollment, billing, covered services, new card requests, and Medicare prescription drug plans. Provides information on Medicare-certified nursing homes, including summaries of state inspections, and can assist callers in locating physicians. The website also provides information and interactive tools to enroll in Medicare, request a new card, find physicians, and compare nursing homes.
site_details:
? Online: Visit website for information and interactive tools to enroll in Medicare, request a new card, find physicians, and compare nursing homes.  ? Phone: Call the helpline with questions about claims or other personal Medicare information. 
? Live Chat: Visit https://www.medicare.gov/talk-to-someone to chat with a representative online about Medicare related questions.
site_eligibility: Open

agency_desc: The national government agency that oversees Social Security and Medicare insurance programs.
service_description: A voluntary employment program that increases the choices and opportunities for eligible Social Security disability beneficiaries to obtain employment, vocational rehabilitation and other support services from public and private providers, employers and other organizations without endangering their disability benefits including health care coverage. Beneficiaries receive a Ticket which they may use to obtain services and jobs from state vocational rehabilitation agencies or organizations that have been designated as Employment Networks (EN) by the program.
site_details:
? Online Portal: Visit website for information or to enroll.
? Helpline: Call for information or to enroll.

○ Online Portal: Daily 24 hours
○ Helpline: Mon-Fri 8am-8pm

○ Online Portal: Daily 24 hours
○ Helpline: Mon-Fri 8am-8pm

agency_desc: A nonprofit agency providing low-cost reproductive health services.
service_description: Offers confidential, in-clinic abortion services to those living in Illinois and surrounding states. Medication abortion, or the abortion pill, is available up to 11 weeks and 0 days gestation; in-clinic, or surgical, abortion services are offered up to 21 weeks and 6 days gestation. Financial assistance may be available.
site_details: Call or visit the website to find clinic locations, make an appointment, or connect with a patient navigator.
site_eligibility: Open; serves pregnant individuals of any age

agency_desc: A commercial online tool that allows users to create a profile and list different needs within their household before a disaster strikes, such as medical information.
service_description: Provides registration of pertinent contact information of persons who may need special assistance in an emergency such as a fire or severe weather. This information can help local first responders be proactive in gaining access to persons in vulnerable situations.
site_details: Visit website to check if service is available in local community. -OR- Visit website to register.
site_eligibility: Open

agency_desc: A nonprofit organization providing assistance and support services to veterans and their families.
service_description: Provides hospitality services to families affected by veteran suicide, care and comfort to homeless veterans, and serves as a veteran liaison between other organizations.
taxonomy_category: Mental Health and Substance Use Disorder Services
site_details: Call for information or to request assistance.
site_eligibility: Immediate family of veteran -- Veterans experiencing homelessness

agency_desc: A nonprofit agency offering a twelve-step program to help people stop eating compulsively.
service_description: Offers a 12-Step support group for people who desire to stop eating compulsively. No fees, dues, or weigh-ins. Meetings are offered in-person, online, by telephone, or non-real-time.
site_details: Visit the website for meeting times, locations, and contact information. -- Walk in to any meeting. -- Call for more information.
site_schedule: Meetings: Vary by location -- Phone: Varies; Website and Voicemail: Daily 24 hours

agency_desc: A national nonprofit organization offering financial and budget counseling, debt management, homebuyer education, and foreclosure prevention services.
service_description: Provides free comprehensive review of income, expenses, and financial goals by a certified financial specialist. Participants will receive a customized action plan outlining steps to help achieve financial goals.
site_details: Visit the website or call to request a financial review.

service_description: Helps registered people with multiple sclerosis (MS) obtain durable medical equipment and home modification.

agency_desc: A nonprofit focused on the prevention, control, and cure of arthritis and related diseases.
service_name: INFORMATION AND EDUCATION FOR THOSE WITH ARTHRITIS AND RELATED DISEASES
service_description: Offers printed literature and online information about arthritis, fibromyalgia, and related conditions. Provides educational presentations and sponsors special events to support arthritis research and awareness.
site_details: Call to request educational brochures or presentations, general disease information, and support referrals.
site_eligibility: Open

agency_desc: Broadband service provider with a low-cost internet option for low-income families.
service_description: Provides basic home Internet for a low monthly fee with free activation, no contract, and no installation fees for qualifying households. Approved customers have the option to purchase a laptop or desktop computer at a discounted price.
site_details: Call or visit the website (www.internetessentials.com) to apply online.
site_eligibility: Living within the Comcast service area -- Meet eligibility criteria -- Have not subscribed to Comcast Internet within the last 90 days -- No outstanding debt to Comcast that is less than one year old -- New Internet Essentials customers applying for the two free months of service must apply by Jun 30, 2022.

agency_desc: A commercial service provider with a low-cost internet options for low-income families.
service_description: Provides discounted home Internet services to low income households in the Spectrum service area. Spectrum Internet Assist provides a monthly discount on basic home Internet, as well as free activation and a waiver of deposit for new, local-service customers. All installation and equipment fees will be waived. Approved customers may choose to purchase a low-cost computer. Service is provided with no commitment and may be canceled any time.
site_details: Call for a phone screening to pre-qualify. -- An application will be sent via mail or email. Send back all required documents.
site_schedule: Call Center: Daily 24 hours -- Computer Information: Mon-Fri 8:30am-5pm -- Eligibility Team: Mon-Fri 8am-11pm
site_eligibility: Living within the Spectrum service area -- Households receiving at least one of the following:  National School Lunch Program (NSLP) -- Community Eligibility Provision (CEP) of NSLP -- Supplemental Security Income (SSI) for age 65 or older -- Have not received Spectrum Internet service in the past 30 days -- Do not have overdue payments with Spectrum Internet service less than a year old

agency_desc: An agency that offers parenting coaching support services for all aspects of parenting, from young children to teens.
service_description: Provides parenting education and strategies; support, and problem solving to parents with children of all ages with a specialty in children age 6-12. One-to-one specific classes are offered to reduce fear and anxiety, and inform parents about child development.
site_details: Call to schedule an appointment or visit the website for more information. www.thepathwaystoparenting.com
site_eligibility: Open

agency_name: UNITED STATES CITIZENSHIP AND IMMIGRATION SERVICES
agency_desc: A federal government agency that oversees lawful immigration to the United States.
site_name: UNITED STATES CITIZENSHIP AND IMMIGRATION SERVICES - CHICAGO DACA LOCKBOX
service_description: Answers questions and provides information regarding Deferred Action for Childhood Arrivals (DACA), an administration policy that provides eligible, undocumented immigrants a two-year deferred deportation and possible employment authorization.
site_details: Call or visit the website for information.
site_schedule: Phone: Mon-Fri 8am-8pm -- Automated line and website: Daily 24 hours
Phone: Mon-Fri 8am-8pm -- Automated line and website: Daily 24 hours
site_eligibility: To request consideration: Under the age of 31 as of June 15, 2012 -- Arrived in the US before 16th birthday -- Have continuously resided in the US since June 15, 2007, to the present time -- Physically present in the US on June 15, 2012, and at the time of requesting deferred action with USCIS -- Entered without inspection before June 15, 2012, or lawful immigration status expired as of June 15, 2012 -- Currently in school, graduated or obtained a certificate of completion from high school, obtained a GED, or are an honorably discharged veteran of the Coast Guard or Armed Forces of the United States -- Have not been convicted of a felony, significant misdemeanor, three or more other misdemeanors, and do not otherwise pose a threat to national security or public safety

agency_name: UNITED STATES CITIZENSHIP AND IMMIGRATION SERVICES
agency_desc: A federal government agency that oversees lawful immigration to the United States.
site_name: UNITED STATES CITIZENSHIP AND IMMIGRATION SERVICES - CHICAGO FIELD
service_description: Handles scheduled interviews on non-asylum-related immigration applications. Most applications can be filed online or by mail. Appointments can be scheduled for the local office for applications or petitions that require in-person filing.
site_details: Call the National Customer Service Center or use the online INFOPASS (infopass.uscis.gov) to schedule an appointment. (Appointments are required for in-person visits or to speak with a local Immigration Information Officer.)
site_schedule: Phone: Mon-Fri 8am-8pm -- Chicago Field Office: Mon-Fri, by appointment only
Phone: Mon-Fri 8am-8pm -- Chicago Field Office: Mon-Fri, by appointment only
site_eligibility: Filing a USCIS form that requires a visit to the local field office

agency_desc: Federal agency in charge of mail delivery and related services.
service_description: Accepts complaints of suspected mail scams, including sweepstakes mailings, work-at-home offers, and lotteries. Also accepts reports of mail theft, tampering, and identity theft when the United States Mail is used. A website with tips and educational information is available to help people avoid becoming a victims.
site_details: Call or visit the website to file a report; anonymous reports are accepted.
site_eligibility: Open

agency_name: CENTERS FOR DISEASE CONTROL AND PREVENTION
agency_desc: A federal government agency providing science-based education and tools aimed at protecting health and preventing disease, injury, and disability for individuals living in the United States.
site_name: CENTERS FOR DISEASE CONTROL AND PREVENTION
service_description: Provides science-based information on a wide range of health topics, including specific diseases and health conditions, vaccinations, international travel health information and cruise ship scores, workplace health and safety, toxic and environmental hazard exposure, vital records, and more.
site_details: Call or visit website for more information.
site_schedule: CDC Info Line: Mon-Fri 8am-8pm -- Website: Daily 24 hours
site_eligibility: Open

agency_desc: A nonprofit organization providing opportunities for the youth such as, summer camps and afterschool programs throughout Northern Indiana and Southwestern Michigan.
service_description: Provides youth development and recreation for boys and girls in kindergarten through 12th grade. Clubs are available at various locations in St Joseph and surrounding counties. Summer camp takes place at Camp Tannadoonah in Michigan.
site_details: Call for registration information on local clubs and summer camp.
site_eligibility: Students grades K-12

agency_name: CANINE COMPANIONS FOR INDEPENDENCE - NORTH CENTRAL REGION
agency_desc: A nonprofit organization that provides highly trained assistance dogs to adults and children with disabilities.
site_name: CANINE COMPANIONS FOR INDEPENDENCE - NORTH CENTRAL REGION
service_description: Provides service dogs free of charge to qualified persons with a physical, developmental, or hearing disability. Places facility dogs with qualified agencies or individuals. This agency can also provide information about service animals, the process of raising a service animal, and local volunteer opportunities.
site_details: Visit website for application information.
site_eligibility: At least 18 years old for an assistance dog -- At least 5 years old to be considered for a skilled companion -- Persons with a physical, developmental, or hearing disability -- Capable of caring for a dog

agency_desc: A nonprofit organization working to connect people to programs that will help them afford their medications and other healthcare costs.
service_description: Provides a searchable directory of patient assistance programs that offer free or discounted medications to uninsured and underinsured persons in need. Low-cost programs may not be available for all prescriptions.
site_details: Call or visit the website for information.
site_eligibility: Vary by program

agency_desc: A nonprofit organization working to connect people to programs that will help them afford their medications and other healthcare costs.
service_description: Provides information about community-sponsored sharps disposal resources/sites and other options for safe sharps disposal.
site_details: Visit the website or call to find local disposal options and additional resources related to the safe disposal of sharps/needles.
site_eligibility: Open

agency_desc: Provides free credit reports, information about credit monitoring, and identity theft protection.
service_description: Enables consumers to place a fraud alert in their files, alerting potential creditors to the fact that they may have been victims of identity theft. Doing so makes it more difficult for credit to be granted on an account, helping protect against further fraudulent use. An initial fraud alert stays in a person's file for at least 90 days; an extended alert stays for seven years.
site_details: Call any one of the three nationwide consumer credit reporting companies (Equifax, Experian, or TransUnion) to request a fraud alert be placed on your account. --(Equifax also enables you to report fraud on their website.) -- Provide appropriate proof of identity, which may include Social Security number. -- As soon as that agency processes your fraud alert, it will notify the other two companies, which then also must place fraud alerts in your file.
site_eligibility: Open

agency_desc: Provides free credit reports, information about credit monitoring, and identity theft protection
service_description: Enables consumers to place a fraud alert in their files, alerting potential lenders to the fact that they may have been victims of identity theft. Doing so makes it more difficult for credit to be granted on an account, helping protect against further fraudulent use.
site_details: Call or visit the website to place a fraud alert.
site_eligibility: Anyone suspecting identity theft

agency_desc: A nonprofit association that provides education and mentorship to small start-up businesses.
service_description: Provides free, confidential, one-on-one consultation to new, prospective, and established business and nonprofit owners. Information and guidance includes how to start or grow a business and how to resolve problems with an existing business. One-on-one mentoring by retired business professionals and entrepreneurs is available by phone, in person, and by email. Local and online workshops are offered periodically.
site_details: Visit the website for information or to schedule an appointment.
site_schedule: Vary by location; website available 24 hours
site_eligibility: Persons who own a business or are interested in starting a business

agency_desc: A national provider of wireless voice, messaging, and data services. Lifeline discounted service is available through subsidiary Safelink Wireless.
service_description: Offers a free cell phone and 350 minutes of free nationwide wireless voice service each month to Indiana households receiving public assistance or within set income guidelines. Minutes do not roll over from month to month. Additional minutes can be purchased. Limit one Lifeline service per household. Promotion available for 500 free minutes for the first four months.
site_details: Call or visit website for an application. -- Mail or fax completed application along with any required documentation. -- Customers must make at least one call per month and must reapply each year to continue service.
site_eligibility: Living in Indiana (or another state in the service area) -- Household income at or below 135% Federal Poverty Guidelines -OR-   receiving Medicaid, food stamps, SSI, TANF, Section 8, EAP, or free school lunch -- No one in household already receiving Lifeline discounted service (landline or wireless)

agency_desc: A nonprofit organization providing information on the prevention and management of primary and secondary lymphedema.
service_description: Provides information and referral as well as education and outreach services related to primary and secondary lymphedema. Maintains lists of treatment providers, support groups, and other resources for lymphedema patients and their families, health care professionals, and the general public.
site_details: Call for information and referrals. -- Many services are available online (including treatment and support group searches).
site_eligibility: Open

agency_desc: A national, community-based nonprofit organization that works to improve the quality of life of heart patients and their families through ongoing peer-to-peer support, education, and advocacy.
service_description: Offers support groups and educational materials for adults with heart disease (Mended Hearts) and for families of  children with congenital heart conditions (Mended Little Hearts).
site_details: Call or visit the website to find your local chapter.
site_eligibility: With any form of heart disease or parents of children with heart disease

agency_desc: A nonprofit agency that provides information, referrals, advocacy, and support for persons affected by neurofibromatosis.
service_description: Provides information about neurofibromatosis (NF) as well as physician referrals, educational materials, advocacy, and support networks for persons with neurofibromatosis.
site_details: Call the office or visit the website for information.
site_eligibility: Living in Indiana, Illinois, Iowa, Kentucky, Wisconsin, or Missouri -- Some services limited to persons with neurofibromatosis and their loved ones

agency_desc: The Department of Veterans Affairs provides veterans with health care and benefits.
service_description: Provides comprehensive inpatient and outpatient health care services to qualified veterans, including doctor's visits, laboratory work, surgery, rehabilitation, pharmacy services, and primary and specialty care services. Co-pay determined by benefits and income.
site_details: New Patients: Visit the website, call, or walk in to the Registrar office at the hospital to complete  an Application for Health Care Benefits. -- Returning Patients (and new patients who have received a letter of approval): Call to schedule an appointment.
site_schedule: Eligibility Office: Mon-Fri 8am-4:30pm -- Hospital: Daily 24 hours
site_eligibility: Honorably discharged or currently serving US Veterans (including reservists/National Guard)

agency_desc: A nonprfit organization that coordinates volunteer pilots and low-income medical patients in need of transportation to and from medical facilities.
service_name: FREE FLIGHTS FOR PEOPLE IN NEED
service_description: Provides free air transportation to and from medical facilities for patients in financial need. Volunteer pilots transport eligible patients up to 1,000 miles each way. Generally, one family member or support person may accompany the patient.
site_details: Visit the website and click the Passenger Menu tab to complete and submit Flight Request Forms, or call and provide contact information. An AFC flight coordinator will respond to the request. (Patients may call directly or have someone make the request on their behalf.)
site_eligibility: In need of air transportation for medical treatment -- Financial need (verified by a professional) -- Medically stable (verified by a physician) -- Visit the AFC website for a complete list, or call for additional requirements.

agency_desc: A nonprofit organization that provides a hiv/aids clinic.
service_description: Offers a monthly support group for persons living with HIV/AIDS. Family and friends are also welcome.
site_details: Call to register.
site_eligibility: HIV/AIDS patients and their loved ones

agency_desc: Offers a full-service hospital providing a wide range of diagnostic, treatment, and health care programs, including 24-hour emergency care.
service_description: Provides a 24-hour nurse advice line where the community can get advice for health-related questions. A registered nurse addresses concerns and, if needed, can refer to treatment options within the Hospital network. Callers with emergency, life-threatening concerns are asked to call 9-1-1 instead.

agency_desc: A federal government organization that provides federal support and assistance in the areas of disaster preparation, prevention, and recovery. Upon declaring a disaster, this agency offers grants or low-interest loans to eligible individuals and businesses for disaster-related expenses, such as temporary housing, building repairs, and replacement of property.
service_description: Provides financial assistance to the victims of the March 2023 tornadoes. Federal money can be used for temporary housing and home repairs, low-cost loans to cover uninsured property losses, and other programs to help individuals and business owners recover from the disaster.
site_details: Visit www.disasterassistance.gov or call 800-621-3362 to apply for assistance. -- After you apply you will be given a 9-digit FEMA registration number. Make sure to keep that number because it will be needed whenever you contact FEMA.
site_schedule: Customer Service: Mon-Fri 7am-1am -- Online Application: Daily 24 hours
site_eligibility: Living in Johnson, Monroe, Morgan, Owen, or Sullivan County -- Victim of the March 2023 tornadoes

agency_desc: A federal government organization that provides federal support and assistance in the areas of disaster preparation, prevention, and recovery. Upon declaring a disaster, this agency offers grants or low-interest loans to eligible individuals and businesses for disaster-related expenses, such as temporary housing, building repairs, and replacement of property.
service_description: Help people before, after and during disasters. Provides financial assistance for COVID-19 related funeral expenses incurred after Jan 20, 2020.
site_details: Call to apply for assistance.
site_eligibility: Death must have occurred in United States, including U.S. Territories, and the District of Columbia -- Death certificate must indicate the death due to COVID-19 -- The applicant: Must be a U.S. citizen, non-citizen national, -OR- qualified alien who incurred funeral expenses after Jan 20, 2020 -- The deceased person: There is NO requirement for the person to have been a U.S. citizen, non-citizen national or qualified alien

agency_desc: A nonprofit agency that provides low-cost reproductive health services.

Also offers medication and surgical abortions for individuals who are 21 weeks and 6 days pregnant or less. Ohio law requires women to receive in-person, state-mandated information 24 hours prior to abortion services.
site_details: Call to speak with a patient navigator. -- Call or visit the website to make an appointment.
site_schedule: Patient Navigator: daily 24 hours -- Individual clinic hours vary by site; see website for details.

agency_desc: A commercial telecommunications company that offers government-sponsored Lifeline discounted telephone service.
service_description: Provides discounted landline phone services to eligible households in the Frontier service area. Lifeline provides a monthly discount on basic, local telephone service, as well as discounted line-connection fees and a waiver of deposit for new, local-service customers.
site_details: Call or visit website for an application. -- Mail or fax completed application along with any required documentation.
site_schedule: Customer Service Contact Center: Mon-Fri 7am-9pm; Sat 8am-6pm
site_eligibility: Households in Frontier telephone service area (includes telephone exchanges throughout Indiana) -- Household income at or below 135% Federal Poverty Level -OR- households receiving any of the following benefits: Medicaid -- Supplemental Nutrition Assistance Program (SNAP)/food stamps -- Section 8 Housing Assistance -- Low-Income Energy Assistance Program (EAP) -- Temporary Assistance for Needy Families (TANF)-- National School Lunch Program Assistance -- No one in household already receiving Lifeline discounted service (landline or wireless)

site_eligibility: Open

agency_desc: A nonprofit organization that provides free air transportation for cancer patients, stem cell donors/recipients, and bone marrow donors/recipients, traveling to and from nationally recognized treatment centers, using the empty seats on corporate jets.

site_details: Call for information. Contact may be made up to 3 weeks before appointment date.
site_eligibility: Must be ambulatory -- Must be free of life-support -- Must be going to a treatment center recognized by either the National Cancer Institute or the American College of Surgeons

site_name: AMERICAN RED CROSS OF GREATER LOUISVILLE
service_description: Relays messages containing verified information about urgent family situations (such as the death or serious illness of an immediate family member, the birth of a child or grandchild, or a family crisis) to service members stationed anywhere in the world.
site_details: Call or submit a request online, be prepared to provide the following information (calling is encouraged if not all of the following information is available) -- For Service Member: Full legal name -- Rank/rating -- Branch of service -- Social Security number or date of birth -- Military unit address --  Information about the deployed and home base unit (if applicable) -- For the Emergency: Name/contact information for immediate family-- Nature of the emergency -- Contact information for where the emergency can be verified
site_eligibility: Active duty US Armed Forces members, activated members of the Guard or Reserves, or civilians   employed or contracted to the Department of Defense stationed outside of the Continental United States and their immediate family members -- With urgent message to convey, such as a birth, death, or family crisis

agency_desc: A national provider of wireless voice, messaging, and data services, i wireless is a partnership between T-Mobile USA and Iowa Network Services (INS). Lifeline discounted service is available through subsidiary Access Wireless.
service_description: Offers a free cell phone and 250 minutes of free, nationwide, wireless voice or texts service each month to Indiana households receiving public assistance or within set income guidelines. Minutes do not roll over from month to month. Additional minutes can be purchased. Limit one Lifeline service per household.
site_details: Call or visit website for an application.-- Customers must make at least one call per month and must reapply each year to continue service.
site_eligibility: Living in Indiana (or another state in the service area) -- Household income at or below 135% Federal Poverty Guidelines -OR- receiving Medicaid, food stamps, SSI, TANF, Section 8, EAP, or free school lunch -- No one in household already receiving Lifeline discounted service (landline or wireless)

agency_name: BOY SCOUTS OF AMERICA - LINCOLN HERITAGE COUNCIL
agency_desc: A nonprofit organization with a strong focus on the outdoors and survival skills that aims to support young people in their physical, mental, and spiritual development so that they may play constructive roles in society.

service_description: Offers an adventure-themed leadership program for young men and women. This program is available at various sites throughout the region.
site_details: Call the council office for information about joining the nearest Venturing program.
site_eligibility: Age 14-21 years-old (or age 13, if completed 8th grade)

agency_desc: A non-profit that provides guide dogs to people who are blind and visually impaired to enhance their mobility, independence and quality of life.
service_description: Provides a trained guide dog and a 25-day training program, including travel expenses and room and board, free of charge to legally blind individuals. Special training programs are also available for deaf-blind individuals and for teens.
site_details: Visit the website to apply or print and mail in application. Call for information.
site_eligibility: Legally blind or visually Impaired -- Age 16 or older -- In good mental and physical health

agency_name: AMERICAN ACADEMY OF COSMETIC DENTISTRY - CHARITABLE FOUNDATION
agency_desc: A foundation that connects victims of domestic violence to volunteer dentists.
site_name: AMERICAN ACADEMY OF COSMETIC DENTISTRY- CHARITABLE FOUNDATION
service_description: Provides restorative and cosmetic dentistry in the "smile zone" (any of the front eight teeth) at no cost to qualified domestic-abuse or sexual assault survivors, or adults whose injuries were the result of family violence. Services are provided through a nationwide network of volunteer cosmetic dentists, laboratories, and dental manufacturers. This program does not replace work that has already been repaired and does not correct errors caused by tooth neglect.
site_details: 1) Visit website for online application (preferred), visit website to download a paper application, or call to have a paper application mailed. 2) Complete application with the assistance of a domestic violence counselor/advocate. 3) Make a copy of the application to retain for personal files. 4) Submit completed online application or mail paper application with money order (mail or fax with proof of community service). 5) Wait to be notified by mail of case status (within 60 days). 6) If approved, wait for a letter with contact information for the volunteer dentist who has accepted the case. 7) Contact the assigned dentist to set up a consultation.
site_eligibility:
Age 18 or older -- Received dental injuries to any of the front 8 teeth from a sexual assault, an intimate partner in a domestic assault, or a victim of family violence -- Have been out of the abusive relationship for at least one year   NOTE: Applications will be accepted before the one-year mark, but will be placed on hold until the requirement is met. -- Have met with a domestic violence/sexual assault advocate, social worker, counselor, minister, therapist or doctor at least once to complete application
*NO LONGER ACCEPT FAITH LEADERS

agency_desc: The federal agency responsible for registering citizens for selective service.
service_description: Provides registration for the United States Selective Service, which is required for most males, ages 18 through 25, who are US citizens or immigrants living in the United States.
site_details: Register using any of the following methods: Online at www.sss.gov (Social Security number required for this method) -- By Mail: Forms are available at all US post offices, and Reminder Mailback Cards are also sent directly to many men around age 18. (Postage required.) -- At School: Many high schools have an appointed Selective Service Registrar. -- On Federal Student Financial Aid (FAFSA) forms: Mark the Selective Service checkbox. For information about your selective service number, proof of registration, and other issues, call the Registration Information Office.
site_eligibility: Selective Service registration is required for ALL persons meeting the following criteria: Males  -- Age 18-25 years-old (early submission possible starting at age 17 years-old and 3 months) -- US citizens, dual nationals, or immigrants living in the United States (except those with student or visitor visas or who are part of a diplomatic or trade mission) -- Not currently serving in the military on full-time active duty or staying in a hospital, mental institution, or prison

agency_desc: A Twelve Step Recovery group for persons who are addicted to Crystal Meth.

site_schedule: Helpline: Voicemail available daily 24 hours -- Meetings: Vary by meeting location
site_eligibility: People who are (or think they may be) addicted to crystal meth

agency_desc: Provide and enhance care and support for all affected; and to reduce the risk of dementia through the promotion of brain health.
service_description: Offers a program that assists in the safe return of an at-risk person who may wander off or become lost. A database stores the wanderer's personal identifying information (such as emergency contacts, medications, and photo) and is accessed by a network of responders to reconnect them with their caregiver. A customized, medical identification bracelet or pendent is included.
site_details: Call for information and request an application. Return forms by fax or mail.
site_schedule: Mon-Fri 11am-8pm Emergency Response Line: Daily 24 hours
site_eligibility: Persons with cognitive health conditions that may cause them wander and become lost

agency_desc: A nonprofit organization that assists eligible persons in receiving prosthetic care.
service_description: Provides prosthetic assistance for lower limb amputees who have no other means of receiving a prosthesis. Services are provided at partnering clinics nationwide.
site_details: Visit website to download application, or call to have application sent by mail. -- Complete application form -- Find a local prosthetic clinic who will agree to work with this agency to provide services, and have that agency complete their portion of the application. See website for a list of partner clinics.-- Mail, fax, or email completed application to Limbs for Life.
site_eligibility: US citizens or legal residents of the United States -- In need of a leg prosthetic -- With NO insurance coverage or government assistance for prosthetics -- With financial need (based on assessment) -- Applicants must find a prosthetist or clinic willing to work with this agency. -- Patients with felony or misdemeanor criminal histories are considered on a case-by-case basis

site_details: Call regional headquarters during office hours; after-hours emergency assistance calls will be forwarded to the appropriate contact. -- Explain the situation, including the nature of the disaster and resulting needs. -- The agency will then conduct an assessment and seek verification, such as ordering a fire report or contacting a landlord.
site_eligibility: Open -- People whose basic needs are not being met as an immediate result of a natural or man-made disaster

agency_name: UNITED STATES DEPARTMENT OF THE TREASURY
agency_desc: A federal-government agency that provides a service to collect debts from taxpayers.
service_description: Serves as the United States Government's central debt collection agency. The Treasury Offset Program (TOP) identifies federal and state debts owed and can withhold tax refunds to offset (pay towards) the debt. Any remaining tax refund balance after the debt is paid is issued to the tax payer. Persons filing a joint return, who are not responsible for their spouses debt, should request the Form 8379 for reimbursement. Tax refunds may be intercepted to pay: Federal agency non-tax debts including federal student, mortgage, or small business loans -- Federal salary or benefit over payments, fines, or penalties -- Past-due child support payments -- State income tax obligations -- Unemployment compensation over payments -- SNAP Benefit over payment
site_details: Call or visit the website.
site_eligibility: Open

agency_desc: A national program providing youth outreach, including immediate help and safety.
service_description: Provides sites nationwide where youth in crisis can go for help. Trained volunteers come to the sites as needed to help youth problem solve and access services. Sites are marked with a yellow-and-black "SafePlace" sign; some sites include: Fire Stations -- Public libraries --  Schools -- Community Centers -- Boys and Girls Clubs -- YMCA locations
site_details: Visit website to find the nearest Safe Place site.  -OR- Text SAFE and your current location (address, city, state) to 4HELP (44357) for immediate help.
site_schedule: Text/Website: Daily 24 hours -- Safe Place Sites: Vary by location
site_eligibility: Currently in a participating state -- Youth up to age 17 (some sites serve up to age 21) -- Facing a crisis (lost, in danger, with a drunk or unsafe driver, experiencing   problems at home, including abuse or neglect, etc.)

agency_desc: A nonprofit agency committed to empowering adults to prevent child sexual abuse.

This line also provides answers to questions about mandatory reporting and referrals to local resources.

agency_desc: A nonprofit organization that offers income-eligible immigrants a wide range of legal services from attorneys and trained staff.
service_description: Provides consultation, direct legal services, and representation for immigration services, family based petitions, unaccompanied immigrant children, naturalization, citizenship, LGBT immigrants, and refugee adjustment. Services include applications for cases involving Deferred Action for Childhood Arrivals (DACA), asylum, Green Cards, or work permits, U visa for victims of crimes, and T visa for victims of trafficking. Assists people in deportation proceedings or renewals, consular proceedings and waivers, Violence Against Women Act (VAWA) petitions, and with special immigrant juvenile status, and the Nicaraguan Adjustment/Central American Relief Act (NACARA).
site_details: Call to schedule an appointment.
site_eligibility: Income at or below 200% Federal Poverty Level

agency_desc: Provides access to brand name and generic prescription medication at low cost.
service_description: Provides access to brand name and generic prescription medication at low cost. An online catalog is available to find specific medications and discounted costs. A supply is given for up to 90 or 180 days at a time. Medications are available to patients with or without insurance. Medications may be mailed directly to the patient's home; free shipping is available.
site_details: Call to speak with a Patient Advocate for information and begin enrollment. Voicemails are returned within two business days. -OR- visit the website to enroll online. Be prepared to offer personal information, prescription order, and household income.
site_eligibility: Household income at or below 300% of the Federal Poverty Level -- With a doctor's prescription

agency_desc: A nonprofit agency that offers eyecare program to those in need.
service_description: Nationwide program provides referrals to free,  glaucoma eye exams and initial treatment (if necessary) for uninsured persons who are at increased risk of glaucoma and who have not had an eye exam within the past 12 months. Risk assessment is based on age, race, and family history of glaucoma. Also offers resource material on eye diseases.
site_details: Visit website to take an online referral questionnaire to determine eligibility. -- Eligible candidates will receive a letter in the mail within 2 weeks with referral information. Ineligible candidates will be notified upon completion of the online questionnaire.
site_schedule: Mon-Fri 8am-noon (Hours of operation are Pacific Time)
Mon-Fri 8am-noon (Hours of operation are Pacific Time)
site_eligibility: US citizens or legal residents -- Not had an eye exam in 12 months or more -- At increased risk of glaucoma based on age, race, or family history of glaucoma -- Not insured through an HMO or receiving veteran's eye-care benefits

service_description: Offers a support helpline for veterans, and their families, to access free mental health care and counseling services. Participants are connected with local professionals well-versed in military culture. Services include assessment and referral, individual, couple, and family therapy, online message boards, substance abuse groups, and therapeutic retreats for military families.
taxonomy_category: Mental Health and Substance Use Disorder Services
site_details: Call to schedule an appointment with a local therapist. -- Sign up with a support group online.
site_eligibility: Veterans (of any status) and their loved ones

agency_name: HELEN KELLER NATIONAL CENTER FOR DEAFBLIND YOUTHS AND ADULTS
agency_desc: A nonprofit organization offering assistance to the deaf-blind community.
site_name: HELEN KELLER NATIONAL CENTER FOR DEAFBLIND YOUTHS AND ADULTS - REGION 5
service_name: INFORMATION AND REFERRAL FOR VISION AND HEARING IMPAIRED
service_description: Provides information, referral, support and advocacy to individuals with combined vision and hearing loss.
site_details: Call or visit website for information; access agency's e-newsletter from website.
site_eligibility: Residents with combined vision and hearing loss -- Families -- Professionals

agency_desc: A nonprofit organization that provides outreach education and installation support for the CapTel captioned phone.
service_description: Provides and installs free or low cost closed captioned telephones to eligible persons with hearing loss.
site_details: Call or email to schedule an appointment. A local Indiana Representative will install phone. No referral required; however, a physician or audiologist statement is required for a free phone.
site_schedule: Indiana Office: Mon-Fri 8am-5pm  -- Installations: By appointment only
site_eligibility: Individuals with hearing loss

agency_desc: A non-profit that provides personalized learning opportunities for persons with visual impairments to live independently.
service_description: Provides a free multimedia distance education program for adults experiencing vision loss to maintain an independent lifestyle. This programming offers practical ways to address daily living skills through audio lectures, short instructional videos, courses, as well as live and archived webinars.
site_details: Call for free materials and to request an application for tuition free Hadley courses.
site_eligibility: Persons with visual impairments or family members, caregivers, and service providers of those with visual impairments.

agency_desc: A commerical agency that prepares and delivers frozen meals to older adults and people with disabilities who are unable to shop and/or prepare food for themselves or travel to a site where meals are being served.
service_description: Delivers frozen meals to homebound persons. Limited special diet meals like reduced concentrated sweets and low sodium diets are available. A minimum of 10 meals are delivered by Fed Ex or UPS for private pay clients.
site_details: Call to register. Be prepared to provide name, address, phone number, and credit card number to process for private pay callers.
site_schedule: Mon-Fri 9am-6pm -- delivery date Mon-Sat; hours vary
site_eligibility: Open -- With physical, intellectual, emotional, behavioral, or social disabilities

agency_desc: A commercial agency that prepares and delivers flash chilled meals to older adults and people with disabilities who are unable to shop and/or prepare food for themselves or travel to a site where meals are being served.
service_description: Delivers flash chilled meals to homebound persons. Limited special diet meals like reduced concentrated sweets, low sodium diets, and pureed meals are available. A minimum number of meals are required, based upon payer source. Meals are delivered by Mom's Meals trucks or Fed Ex.
site_details: Call or visit the website to register.
site_eligibility: Open

agency_desc: A commercial organization that accepts grocery orders by phone.
service_description: Provides grocery ordering and delivery for individuals that are disabled, senior citizens, do not have a computer, or anyone that does not have time to shop. In most cases, orders are delivered the next day.
site_details: Call to begin ordering process. Leave name and number; calls are returned the same day. Be prepared to provide your grocery list and have Credit Card available. Categorize items the best you can. Save invoices from your delivered orders as a guide to categorizing your next order.
site_eligibility: Open

agency_desc: A commercial organization that provides home and GPS tracking medical alert devices and trained operators that monitor and dispatch first responders or call pre-arranged emergency contacts 24/7 based on the need. This service is designed to preserve an individual's safety and independence.
service_description: Provides electronic equipment which connects frail seniors or people who have disabilities with police or other emergency response personnel after a fall, injury, or other medical emergencies.  Electronic devices that can be rented include Personal Emergency Response Systems (PERS) for home or mobile units with GPS tracking, and Auto Fall Sensors.  Additional features that are available include smoke, fire, or carbon monoxide detectors.
site_details: Call to schedule an appointment. Be advised discounts are offered to private pay callers that mention CICOA or any area agency.
site_eligibility: Individuals at risk of falls or other injuries -- Individuals at risk of isolation

service_description: Provides and installs free closed captioned telephones for eligible persons dealing with hearing loss. For participants that have some hearing, the telephones digital amplification boosts voice up to 50 decibels.. Provides an app for captioning services.

agency_desc: A commercial organization that provides comprehensive medication management for individuals taking multiple medications.
service_description: Provides comprehensive medication management for individuals taking multiple medications. This includes an in-home patient assessment, medication review, multi-dose adherence packaging, monthly home delivery at no additional cost to patient, and support from a pharmacy team.
site_details: Call to begin process; be prepared to provide client's name, address, phone number, date of birth, and last four of Social Security number.
site_eligibility: Difficulty getting to pharmacy -- Difficulty with medication compliancy

agency_desc: A nonprofit organization that provides prevention awareness, educational programming and that advocates for research to improve the quality of life for all individuals impacted by brain injury.
service_description: Provides information about brain injury and referrals to related services and support groups. Public speakers are also available to interested persons, professionals, survivors, family members, and caregivers throughout Indiana.

agency_desc: Provides help-line assistance in several categories of financial crisis.
